titleStmt.title: DTD Errors and Typographic Errors Reported in TEI P4 Along with Actions Taken
titleStmt.author: Syd Bauman
Lou Burnard

sourceDesc.p: No source; this electronic edition is the original.

encodingDesc.p: n of change may be used to indicate a Perforce change number.

change.item:
Minor structural overhaul. Changed DTD, and thus this instance, so that:
sets of report, action, and change are now grouped explicitly inside the new erf (error report & fix) element. Thus we no longer need to use corresp to indicate associations. (I had originally wanted to use attributes on the theory that there would be a snarly web of relationshops; in reality I have found that there are both many-to-1 and 1-to-many relationships, there are no many-to-many or cross-report relationships, and we can still use attributes for those if we want.)
value of date is required, no content allowed
content model of respStmt a little tighter
Note that I quite quickly divided the current list up into erfs, and may have misappropriated some entries.

Added NOTATION declaration, using one of the URIs I found months ago (See post to TEI-L on the subject); changed name of notation, as XML is a reserved name. Added declaration for url attribute of xref, as I'm too tired and lazy now to update the DTD properly.
added comments from SB; added revisionDesc; wrote stylesheets
added reports and actions
created file

div.note: Note that this document does not have errors reported about the website, nor about the packaging of P4 or the DTDs, only about P4 or the DTDs themselves.

erf.change:
&SB;
Removed a single PCDATA character ("x") that erroneously appeared at the end of an example. File changed: //TEI/P4/Tags/quotn.tag#2

&SB;
Changed a reference to the occurs attribute of tagUsage from usage to occurs in //TEI/P4/Odds/p2hd5.odd#3. (Changed the ODD source file to P5, //TEI/P5/Source/HD/hd.odd, last night.) Note that the HTML has not been regenerated yet.

report.item: In posting to TEI-L points out that name of entity declared in example internal subset in FT.html#FTGRA is graphics but should be figures.

change.item: Fixed: s/TEI\.graphics/TEI.figures/ in p2ftgra.odd#2 and also in p2ftfor.odd#3.

report.item: Sent e-mail Re: HEADs in verse to TEI-L dated indirectly painting out that figure is not permitted before head in a div.

action.item: Reminded the editors of this issue. LB stated solution was to put figure into Incl.

report.item: In e-mail to Syd reported that Chapter 19 states Any document containing app elements requires a variantEncoding declaration in the editorialDecl element of its TEI header, and points to section 5.3.3, … [where] I find that the variantEncoding declaration is a sibling of the editorialDecl and is nested inside the encodingDesc.

change.item: Changed wording in //TEI/P4/Odds/p2tc.odd#2 to make it clear that variantEncoding is a child of encodingDesc.
In file //TEI/P4/Tags/pointer.cla#2 changed the description and attribute type of crdate of pointer to be a real date, like that of date.created of teiHeader.

In several places the prose mentions mileStone instead of milestone. Fixed. (But not in P5 SA, which is scheduled for reversion.) Files: //TEI/P4/Odds/p2hd5.odd#2, //TEI/P4/Odds/p2sase.odd#3, and //TEI/P5/Source/HD/hd.odd#13. Also, in p2sase.odd, reworded the prose discussion of anchor a bit to make it clear that id is required.
Changed content model of lang from paraContent to phrase.seq. File: //TEI/P4/Tags/lang.tag#2. Technically non-corrigible.

Changed a pair of P3 FPIs (for WSD) to P4 FPIs. Changed prose discussing putting lang on an outermost element so that it does not contradict the examples. Files: //TEI/P4/Odds/p2md.odd#3 and edit //TEI/P4/Odds/p2wd.odd#4
In file //TEI/P4/Odds/p2saxr.odd#4, changed the example SPACE keyword value from 2D to D2, as the value is supposed to be of NAME datatype.

Changed the attribute types of the following from CDATA to NMTOKEN. Note that some folks might considerthis a non-corribible change because there might exist values that were valid per the previous DTD but not against this new one. However, some folks would say it is still corribible, because any such values would violate the prose of the Guidelines.
result of join and joinGrp
usage of language
sort of personPart
rows & cols of table
chars & lines of direction Files: edit //TEI/P4/Tags/directn.tag#2, //TEI/P4/Tags/join.tag#2, //TEI/P4/Tags/joingrp.tag#2, //TEI/P4/Tags/language.tag#2, //TEI/P4/Tags/perspart.cla#2, and //TEI/P4/Tags/table.tag#2
The tei attribute of gi and of att is lower case, but the TEI attribute of tag is all uppercase. Fixed by changing the latter to lower case. Non-corrigible. Files: //TEI/P4/Tags/tag.tag#2.

report.item: In e-mail to Lou & me pointed out that on p. 872 of P4:2002 kg is incorrectly included as an example of a measure of weight.This error has been reported multiple times by various people over the years. This one is cited because it is the one that finally instigated the change!

change.item: Added NDATA TEI-XML to example entity declaration. Also changed notation name XML to w3cXML in another example, as the name XML is, of course, reserved. See definition of Name. Files changed were //TEI/P4/Odds/p2saag.odd#2, //TEI/P4/Odds/p2saxr.odd#3, and //TEI/P5/Source/SA/sa.odd#11

The description of the ucs-4 attribute on page 594 of P4:2002 had two-digit whereas the prose that follows on the top of the next page makes it clear that the hyphen is supposed to go between a pair of four-digit hex numbers. I changed two- to four-, but the whole description still a bit confusing. File changed was //TEI/P4/Tags/wsdform.tag#2
Changed tei to TEI.2 in file //TEI/P4/Odds/p2cf.odd#2 (P4:2002 p. 632).

report.item: During phone conversation with Syd pointed out that on p. 403, first full example on the page, the MOMENT value of id does not match the case of the corresponding IDREF, the moment value of ana.

change.item: Changed MOMENT to moment in file //TEI/P4/Odds/p2aisp.odd#2.

report.item: gap not allowed as 1st child of epigraph.

change.item: Complicated fix. Changed the content model of component.seq to ( (%m.Incl;)*, ( (%component;), (%m.Incl;)* )* ). Correspingly needed to then fix the content models of set and argument, so they are now <!ELEMENT %n.set; %om.RR; ( ((%m.Incl;)*, (%n.head;))?, %component.seq;)> <!ELEMENT %n.argument; %om.RR; ( ( (%m.Incl;)*, (%n.head;) )?, %component.seq;)> . It may well be the case that the content of component.seq could have been made ((%m.Incl;)|(%component;))*. Something for investigation at a later date, perhaps.

report.item: In e-mail to Syd & Lou points out that A note in the name documentation says Proper nouns referring to people, places, and organizations may be tagged instead with person, place, or org.. Obviously should be persName, placeName, orgName.

change.item: Changed //TEI/P4/Tags/name.tag#2 accordingly.

report.item: Reported discrepancy between prose and DTD fragment with respect to list of values of eol of hyphenation in e-mail to TEI-L.

Reported in e-mail to editors@tei-c.org that the web version of the Guidelines had been updated to reflect the move of fw from phrase to refsys, but that the DTD files themselves did not reflect this change.

change.item: Re-generated DTDs so that fix was propagated.

Per discussion on TEI-L (during with subject field including PS: Element class change), change class of fw from phrase to refsys, thus making it available almost globally (as with the pbs with which the fws are associated).

action.item: Replied to user's e-mail informing him of change.

report.item:
Reports in e-mail to editors@tei-c.org
In ch. 27, Tag Set Documentation, the section on tagDoc (27.1) says: As the content model for tagDoc makes clear, only the gi, desc, exemplum, dataDesc, parents, children and elemDecl elements are mandatory components. But the declaration of tagDoc actually indicates that only gi, desc, and elemDecl are required.
In ch. 38, Sample Tag Set Documentation, the example for class documentation in section 38.4 is incomplete; it cuts off abruptly mid-element.

list.item: Corrected description of tagDoc in 27.1; file affected: //TEI/P4/Odds/p2td.odd#2

report.item:
In a long post to TEI-L user reported that
the specification of targOrder in two examples in 14.1.1 were reversed, and
the case of the IDs used in the examples no longer matches the case in the prose.

change.item: Moved the specification of targOrder back from the second example to the third where it belongs; changed case of identifiers in prose to lower case, and encoded those that had been left bare as code type=value, as some had been. File changed is p2sapt.odd#20.

report.item: PD reports by email that (a) the exclude attribute is referred to erroneously as "excl"; (b) there is a faulty cross reference to AI (should be to SA): see para beginning "Let us assume..." near start of GD.

change.item: Changed two typos in source file for Graphs and Diagrams chapter: file affected //TEI/XMLodds/Odds/p2gd2.odd

report.item: classes, delSpan, fDecl, hom, m, performance, pVar, superEntry, termEntry (both versions) - dataDescs do not match content models
catRef - the word scheme has not been tagged <att> in the note
constitution - samplingDecl not tagged <gi> in the description
col, line, page - legacy SGML concurrent mark-up syntax in examples
dictScrap - no expanded name
domain - the note should be directly associated with the attribute
lbl - references 12.3.1 twice in see further
mood, number - no attribute value delimiters in notes
name - has "declared in file dummy" huh?
note - place attribute declaration default double delimited
quotation - surplus x at end of exemplum
teiCorpus2 - dataDesc has tei.2, not TEI.2
declarable - undelimited attribute value

These are all petty little quibbles, but I've come across something which disturbs me more significantly. Cast a glance, if you will, at ref-EDITPH. This is ostensibly attribute declarations (resp and cert)for the edit class elements, used only when the transcription tag set is enabled. What concerns me is that the a.edit entity is not then referenced ANYWHERE else in the DTDs (and I've grepped away thoroughly at them); and those elements of the edit class (and that is not all of them) which do have resp and cert define it directly within themselves, leaving this class floating around and never implemented. Should it perhaps be removed, or am I missing something?
